caption:
This photograph captures a dramatic and atmospheric view of a natural landscape under a bright sun. The image mainly features a vast, open space that appears to be a muddy or silt-filled river or floodplain. The terrain is uneven and covered in deep grooves and patterns that suggest the movement of water, possibly a quickly drying area or a shallow riverbed.

The sky dominates the top part of the image, cast with clusters of clouds and a bright sun directly above, causing a flare and a streak of lens flares cascading downwards through the frame. The sunlight is intense enough to create a high contrast scene with deep shadows and bright highlights reflecting off the water surfaces below.

In the foreground, there's a line of lush greenery, perhaps bushes or low-lying shrubs, which forms a natural boundary that frames the bottom edge of the image. This greenery is a stark contrast to the barren, muddy ground of the central and far landscape.

Overall, the composition of this image is both ethereal and rugged, presenting a moment of natural wonder and rough beauty under strong sunlight, producing a mesmerizing yet stark visual effect.
title: Reserve Mining Company's dump site on Lake Superior. Foul smelling steam rises from the mucky water. Reserve's taconite plant at Silver Bay produces iron ore from the taconite rock. It discharges 67,000 tons of waste rock into the lake daily.
